questions.question_text: Which two components are required to configure certificate-based authentication to the web UI when an administrator needs firewall access on a trusted interface? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D

Selected Answer: BD
B. CA certificate
The CA certificate is used to validate the client certificates presented during the authentication process. It ensures that the certificates are issued by a trusted Certificate Authority.

D. Certificate Profile
The Certificate Profile specifies the trusted Certificate Authorities and the certificate validation criteria for client certificates used in the authentication process.

A. Server certificate: While important for establishing secure connections, it is not specifically required for configuring certificate-based authentication to the web UI itself. The server certificate is more related to securing the web interface rather than authenticating administrators.

Selected Answer: BD
Requirements are CA cert, Cert profile, and Client cert for each admin account.

Selected Answer: BD
Requirements are CA cert, Cert profile, and Client cert for each admin.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-1/pan-os-admin/firewall-administration/manage-firewall-administrators/configure-administrative-accounts-and-authentication/configure-certificate-based-administrator-authentication-to-the-web-interface

Selected Answer: A
A

Selected Answer: A
Phase 2 SAs (Security Associations) are synchronized over HA2 links. This ensures that the IPsec tunnels are consistent between the primary and secondary firewalls, allowing for seamless failover in case the active firewall fails.

Phase 1 SAs are not specifically synchronized over HA links; instead, the Phase 1 configuration is usually re-established as part of the failover process.

Selected Answer: A
Phase 1 does not sync.

Selected Answer: A
https://knowledgebase.paloaltonetworks.com/KCSArticleDetail?id=kA14u000000HAuZCAW&lang=en_US%E2%80%A9&refURL=http%3A%2F%2Fknowledgebase.paloaltonetworks.com%2FKCSArticleDetail

questions.question_text: What happens when an A/P firewall pair synchronizes IPsec tunnel security associations (SAs)?

choices.D: Phase 1 and Phase 2 SAs are synchronized over HA3 links.
choices.C: Phase 1 SAs are synchronized over HA1 links.
choices.A: Phase 2 SAs are synchronized over HA2 links.
choices.B: Phase 1 and Phase 2 SAs are synchronized over HA2 links.

choices.C: Perform packet forwarding to the active-passive peer during session setup and asymmetric traffic flow.
choices.B: Perform synchronization of sessions, forwarding tables, and IPSec security associations between firewalls in an HA pair.
choices.D: Perform synchronization of routes, IPSec security associations, and User-ID information.
choices.A: Perform session cache synchronization for all HA cluster members with the same cluster ID.

questions.question_text: Which function does the HA4 interface provide when implementing a firewall cluster which contains firewalls configured as active-passive pairs?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The HA4 link and HA4 backup link perform session cache synchronization among all HA cluster members having the same cluster ID.

Selected Answer: A
The HA4link andHA4backuplinkperform session cache synchronization among all HA cluster members having the same cluster ID. The HA4 link between cluster members detects connectivity failures between cluster members by sending and receiving Layer 2 keepalive
 messages. View the status of the HA4 and HA4 backup links on the firewall dashboard.

Source : PCNSE study guide page 178

Selected Answer: B
"...the app uses the priority and response time to determine the gateway to which to connect. With GlobalProtect app 4.0.2 and earlier releases, the app connects to a lower priority gateway only if the response time for the higher priority gateway is greater than the average response time across all gateways."

Time is 130/4 is 32.5 - East with 35ms is discarded, South become elected.

Selected Answer: B
the algorithm chooses the gateway with the highest priority among those whose response time is less than or equal to the average response time.

Selected Answer: A
In GlobalProtect app 4.0.3 and later releases, the GlobalProtect app prioritizes the gateways assigned highest, high, and medium priority ahead of gateways assigned a low or lowest priority regardless of response time

in this case East is Highest, so i vote A

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

In GlobalProtect app 4.0.3 and later releases, the GlobalProtect app prioritizes the gateways assigned highest, high, and medium priority ahead of gateways assigned a low or lowest priority regardless of response time. The GlobalProtect app then appends any gateways assigned a low or lowest priority to the list of gateways. This ensures that the app first attempts to connect to the gateways that you configure with a higher priority.

The current mainstream version of the GlobalProtect app is 6.2.6, etc.

Selected Answer: B
"In GlobalProtect app 4.0.3 and later releases, the GlobalProtect app prioritizes the gateways assigned highest, high, and medium priority ahead of gateways assigned a low or lowest priority regardless of response time. The GlobalProtect app then appends any gateways assigned a low or lowest priority to the list of gateways. This ensures that the app first attempts to connect to the gateways that you configure with a higher priority."

B

Selected Answer: B

choices.B: Layer 3 zones for the virtual systems that need to communicate.
choices.C: Add a route with next hop set to none, and use the interface of the virtual systems that need to communicate.
choices.D: Ensure the virtual systems are visible to one another.
choices.E: External zones with the virtual systems added.
choices.A: Add a route with next hop next-vr by using the VR configured in the virtual system.

questions.question_text:
A network security engineer needs to ensure that virtual systems can communicate with one another within a Palo Alto Networks firewall. Separate virtual routers (VRs) are created for each virtual system.

In addition to confirming security policies, which three configuration details should the engineer focus on to ensure communication between virtual systems? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADE
ADE
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/virtual-systems/communication-between-virtual-systems/inter-vsys-traffic-that-remains-within-the-firewall/external-zones-and-security-policies-for-traffic-within-a-firewall

Selected Answer: BCD
B. Layer 3 zones for the virtual systems that need to communicate.
C. Add a route with next hop set to none, and use the interface of the virtual systems that need to communicate.
D. Ensure the virtual systems are visible to one another.

Selected Answer: ADE
Study Guide point 1.7.2

Selected Answer: ADE
Answer is based on free LabMinutes videos regarding vsys setup

Step 1: Make vsys visible to each other
Step 2: create external zone on each vsys and make it visible for another vsys
Step 3: if you need routing via another vsys, create route with next-vr as a next hop (if independent virtual routers are used in each vsys)
I say A, D, E
